location.zh-cn: 美国华盛顿哥伦比亚特区国会山庄
location.en: United States Capitol, Washington, D.C., United States

description.zh-cn: 美国国会的两院之一，为美国的下议院。其席位分配以各州人口数为基准，总数固定为435名投票议员。
description.en: One of the two chambers of the United States Congress, serving as the lower house. Seats are apportioned among the states by population, with the total number of voting representatives fixed at 435.

description.zh-cn: 美国的立法机构，由参议院和众议院组成。
description.en: The legislature of the United States, composed of the Senate and the House of Representatives.

description.zh-cn: 美国国会的两院之一，为美国的上议院。
description.en: One of the two chambers of the United States Congress, serving as the upper house.

description.zh-cn: 美国政治人物，共和党籍，自2023年10月25日起担任美国众议院议长。
description.en: American politician and member of the Republican Party, serving as the Speaker of the United States House of Representatives since October 25, 2023.

description.zh-cn: 美国的两个主要政党之一。
description.en: One of the two major political parties in the United States.

en: Speaker of the United States House of Representatives

description.zh-cn: 美国众议院的主持官员，由众议院全体议员选举产生，通常是多数党的领袖。在美国总统继任顺序中位列第二，仅次于副总统。
description.en: The presiding officer of the United States House of Representatives, elected by the full House, and typically the leader of the majority party. The Speaker is second in the U.S. presidential line of succession, after the Vice President.

description.zh-cn: 美国政治人物，共和党籍，自2023年1月3日起担任众议院多数党领袖。
description.en: American politician and member of the Republican Party, serving as the House Majority Leader since January 3, 2023.

description.zh-cn: 美国政治人物，民主党籍，自2023年1月3日起担任众议院少数党领袖。
description.en: American politician and member of the Democratic Party, serving as the House Minority Leader since January 3, 2023.

description.zh-cn: 美国的两个主要政党之一。
description.en: One of the two major political parties in the United States.

description.zh-cn: 美国的最高法律，于1788年获批准，确立了由参众两院组成的国会。
description.en: The supreme law of the United States, ratified in 1788, which established the Congress consisting of a Senate and a House of Representatives.

description.zh-cn: 1787年召开会议，以解决《邦联条例》下的政府效率问题，并最终起草了《美国宪法》。
description.en: Convened in 1787 to address governmental inefficiencies under the Articles of Confederation, ultimately drafting the United States Constitution.

description.zh-cn: 美国的第一部宪法，设立了一院制国会，后因效率低下而被《美国宪法》取代。
description.en: The first constitution of the United States, which established a unicameral congress and was later replaced by the U.S. Constitution due to its inefficiency.

description.zh-cn: 1787年大陆会议期间达成的一项协议，确立了美国国会的两院制结构：众议院按人口比例分配席位，参议院各州席位平等。
description.en: An agreement reached during the 1787 Continental Congress that established the bicameral structure of the U.S. Congress: proportional representation in the House and equal representation in the Senate.

description.zh-cn: 美国19世纪区域性不和的核心问题之一，最终导致了内战并被废除。
description.en: One of the core issues of regional discord in 19th-century America, which ultimately led to the Civil War and its abolition.

description.zh-cn: 因南方诸州脱离联邦而爆发的战争，以南方失败和奴隶制废除告终。
description.en: A war that broke out after southern states seceded from the Union, ending in the defeat of the South and the abolition of slavery.

description.zh-cn: 美国内战后的时期，见证了共和党在国会长期占据多数。
description.en: The period following the American Civil War, which saw a long period of Republican majority in Congress.

description.zh-cn: 1890年代的共和党籍众议院议长，因大幅扩张议长权力而被称为“瑞德沙皇”。
description.en: A Republican Speaker of the House in the 1890s, known as "Czar Reed" for dramatically expanding the powers of the speakership.

description.zh-cn: 1903年至1911年任众议院议长，其权力在任内达到顶峰，后在“1910年革命”中被削减。
description.en: Served as Speaker of the House from 1903 to 1911, during which the Speaker's powers reached their zenith before being curtailed in the "Revolution of 1910."

description.zh-cn: 一场导致众议院议长约瑟夫·葛尼·坎农权力被大幅削减的政治事件。
description.en: A political event that led to a significant reduction in the powers of Speaker of the House Joseph Gurney Cannon.

description.zh-cn: 美国第32任总统，他的上台开启了民主党长期控制众议院的时期。
description.en: The 32nd U.S. President, whose rise to power initiated a long period of Democratic control of the House of Representatives.

description.zh-cn: 美国政治人物，在1994年中期选举中领导“共和党革命”，使共和党重夺众议院控制权。
description.en: American politician who led the "Republican Revolution" in the 1994 midterm elections, which resulted in Republicans regaining control of the House.

description.zh-cn: 指1994年美国中期选举中，共和党在纽特·金瑞契领导下，时隔40年重新获得国会参众两院的控制权。
description.en: Refers to the 1994 U.S. midterm elections where the Republican Party, led by Newt Gingrich, regained control of both the House and Senate for the first time in 40 years.

description.zh-cn: 1998年美国众议院发起的针对总统比尔·克林顿的弹劾程序。
description.en: The impeachment process initiated in 1998 by the U.S. House of Representatives against President Bill Clinton.

description.zh-cn: 美国第42任总统，于1998年被众议院弹劾，但最终被参议院宣告无罪。
description.en: The 42nd U.S. President, who was impeached by the House of Representatives in 1998 but was acquitted by the Senate.

description.zh-cn: 1911年通过的一项美国法律，将众议院的席位总数固定为435席。
description.en: A U.S. law passed in 1911 that fixed the total number of seats in the House of Representatives at 435.

en: Supreme Court of the United States

description.zh-cn: 美国的最高联邦法院。
description.en: The highest federal court in the United States.

description.zh-cn: 一种政治分配方式，指各选区人口数差异巨大，导致票票不等值。美国最高法院在“Wesberry v. Sanders”案中裁定其违宪。
description.en: A political apportionment where districts have significantly different populations, leading to unequal representation. The U.S. Supreme Court ruled it unconstitutional in Wesberry v. Sanders.

description.zh-cn: 一项旨在保障少数族裔投票权的联邦法案，禁止为降低少数民族表决权而进行不公正的选区划分。
description.en: A federal act aimed at protecting the voting rights of minorities, which prohibits gerrymandering intended to diminish minority voting power.

description.zh-cn: 指以不公正的方式划分选区，以增加某方政治势力获胜几率的做法。
description.en: The practice of drawing electoral districts in a way that gives one political party an unfair advantage.

description.zh-cn: 美国第17任总统，于1868年被众议院弹劾，但在参议院以一票之差未被定罪。
description.en: The 17th U.S. President, who was impeached by the House in 1868 but was acquitted in the Senate by a single vote.

description.zh-cn: 美国众议院于1868年针对总统安德鲁·约翰逊发起的弹劾程序。
description.en: The impeachment process initiated in 1868 by the U.S. House of Representatives against President Andrew Johnson.

description.zh-cn: 美国第37任总统，在面临几乎必然的弹劾和定罪时于1974年辞职。
description.en: The 37th U.S. President, who resigned in 1974 while facing almost certain impeachment and removal from office.

nodes.id: 美利坚合众国宪法第十二条修正案

zh-cn: 美利坚合众国宪法第十二条修正案
en: Twelfth Amendment to the United States Constitution

description.zh-cn: 该修正案规定，在没有总统候选人获得选举人团多数票时，由众议院负责选举总统。
description.en: This amendment stipulates that the House of Representatives is responsible for electing the President if no candidate wins a majority in the Electoral College.

description.zh-cn: 美国第3任总统，在1800年选举僵局中由众议院选出。
description.en: The 3rd U.S. President, who was elected by the House of Representatives in the contingent election of 1800.

description.zh-cn: 美国政治人物，在1800年总统选举僵局中被众议院击败。
description.en: American politician who was defeated in the House contingent election for the presidency in 1800.

description.zh-cn: 美国第6任总统，在1824年选举僵局中由众议院选出。
description.en: The 6th U.S. President, who was elected by the House of Representatives in the contingent election of 1824.

description.zh-cn: 美国政治人物，在1824年总统选举僵局中被众议院击败。
description.en: American politician who was defeated in the House contingent election for the presidency in 1824.

description.zh-cn: 美国众议员，于1980年因受贿而被众议院驱逐。
description.en: A U.S. Representative who was expelled from the House in 1980 for bribery.

description.zh-cn: 美国众议员，于2002年因贪污定罪而被众议院驱逐。
description.en: A U.S. Representative who was expelled from the House in 2002 following a corruption conviction.

description.zh-cn: 美国众议院是美国国会的下议院。
description.en: The U.S. House of Representatives is the lower house of the U.S. Congress.

description.zh-cn: 美国参议院是美国国会的上议院。
description.en: The U.S. Senate is the upper house of the U.S. Congress.

description.zh-cn: 迈克·约翰逊于2023年10月25日当选为美国众议院议长。
description.en: Mike Johnson was elected Speaker of the U.S. House of Representatives on October 25, 2023.

description.zh-cn: 迈克·约翰逊是共和党成员。
description.en: Mike Johnson is a member of the Republican Party.

description.zh-cn: 史蒂夫·斯卡利斯是共和党成员，并担任众议院多数党领袖。
description.en: Steve Scalise is a member of the Republican Party and serves as the House Majority Leader.

description.zh-cn: 哈基姆·杰弗里斯是民主党成员，并担任众议院少数党领袖。
description.en: Hakeem Jeffries is a member of the Democratic Party and serves as the House Minority Leader.

description.zh-cn: 《美国宪法》设立了由参议院和众议院组成的两院制国会。
description.en: The U.S. Constitution established a bicameral Congress consisting of the Senate and the House of Representatives.

description.zh-cn: 1787年召开的大陆会议旨在解决《邦联条例》的缺陷，并最终起草了《美国宪法》。
description.en: The Continental Congress convened in 1787 to address the deficiencies of the Articles of Confederation, which led to the drafting of the U.S. Constitution.

description.zh-cn: 康涅狄格妥协案确立了美国国会的两院制结构，解决了大小州之间的代表权争议。
description.en: The Connecticut Compromise established the bicameral structure of the U.S. Congress, resolving the representation dispute between large and small states.

description.zh-cn: 美国内战以北方的胜利告终，并最终导致了奴隶制度的废除。
description.en: The American Civil War ended with the victory of the Union and led to the abolition of slavery.

description.zh-cn: 在内战后的重建时期，共和党长期在国会取得多数席位。
description.en: During the Reconstruction era following the Civil War, the Republican Party held a long-term majority in Congress.

description.zh-cn: 在其议长任期内，汤玛斯·勃兰契特·瑞德极大地扩张了众议院议长的权力。
description.en: During his speakership, Thomas Brackett Reed dramatically increased the power of the Speaker of the House.

description.zh-cn: 由于共和党内保守派的反对和民主党的努力，议长约瑟夫·葛尼·坎农的权力在“1910年革命”中被削减。
description.en: Due to opposition from conservative Republicans and efforts by Democrats, Speaker Joseph Gurney Cannon's powers were curtailed in the "Revolution of 1910."

description.zh-cn: 富兰克林·罗斯福的上台开启了民主党自1933年起长期支配众议院的时代。
description.en: Franklin D. Roosevelt's rise to power began an era of long-term Democratic dominance in the House of Representatives starting in 1933.

description.zh-cn: 纽特·金瑞契领导了1994年的“共和党革命”，使共和党重夺众议院控制权。
description.en: Newt Gingrich led the "Republican Revolution" of 1994, which returned control of the House to the Republican Party.

description.zh-cn: 美国众议院在1998年通过了对比尔·克林顿总统的弹劾条款。
description.en: The U.S. House of Representatives passed articles of impeachment against President Bill Clinton in 1998.

description.zh-cn: 克林顿弹劾案对总统比尔·克林顿的执政构成了严重挑战。
description.en: The impeachment of Bill Clinton posed a significant challenge to his presidency.

description.zh-cn: 1911年的《席次分配法》将众议院的席位总数明定为435席。
description.en: The Apportionment Act of 1911 legally set the total number of seats in the House of Representatives to 435.

description.zh-cn: 美国最高法院在“Wesberry v. Sanders”一案中判决选区不当分配违宪。
description.en: The U.S. Supreme Court ruled malapportionment unconstitutional in the case of Wesberry v. Sanders.

description.zh-cn: 1965年的《选举法案》禁止州政府基于降低少数民族表决权之目的而将选区划分为不规则状（杰利蝾螈）。
description.en: The Voting Rights Act of 1965 prohibits states from gerrymandering districts with the purpose of diminishing the voting power of minorities.

description.zh-cn: 众议院于1868年弹劾了总统安德鲁·约翰逊。
description.en: The House of Representatives impeached President Andrew Johnson in 1868.

description.zh-cn: 参议院在表决中以一票之差未能将安德鲁·约翰逊定罪，弹劾失败。
description.en: The Senate failed to convict Andrew Johnson by a single vote, resulting in his acquittal.

description.zh-cn: 在1800年总统选举出现选举人团僵局后，众议院根据宪法第十二修正案投票选举托马斯·杰斐逊为总统。
description.en: Following an Electoral College tie in the 1800 presidential election, the House of Representatives voted to elect Thomas Jefferson as president under the provisions of the Twelfth Amendment.

description.zh-cn: 在1800年总统选举僵局中，阿龙·伯尔在众议院的权变选举中输给了托马斯·杰斐逊。
description.en: In the contingent election of 1800, Aaron Burr was defeated by Thomas Jefferson in the House of Representatives.

description.zh-cn: 在1824年总统选举出现选举人团僵局后，众议院投票选举约翰·昆西·亚当斯为总统。
description.en: Following an Electoral College tie in the 1824 presidential election, the House of Representatives voted to elect John Quincy Adams as president.

description.zh-cn: 尽管安德鲁·杰克森在1824年总统选举中获得普选票和选举人票的多数，但在众议院的权变选举中输给了约翰·昆西·亚当斯。
description.en: Despite winning a plurality of the popular and electoral votes in the 1824 presidential election, Andrew Jackson was defeated by John Quincy Adams in the contingent election held in the House of Representatives.

description.zh-cn: 1980年，众议员麦可·麦尔斯因受贿而被众议院驱逐。
description.en: In 1980, Representative Michael Myers was expelled from the House of Representatives for bribery.

description.zh-cn: 2002年，众议员詹姆斯·塔福肯因贪污定罪而被众议院驱逐。
description.en: In 2002, Representative James Traficant was expelled from the House of Representatives following a corruption conviction.
